title: Nice Church
review: One of the oldest churches in Dehradun. It was nice, clean and looked as if it just had a fresh coat of paint. IF you like visiting churches you must visit.

title: Good peaceful place
review: Like other churches its a peaceful place. I enjoyed watching and clicking Sparrows here which is now getting extinct from Urban places like Delhi.

title: Serene Church
review: This is a nice Church behind Picture Palace in Mussoorie.

title: Just another church
review: Located at the beginning of the Mall Road, near the Picture Palace there is nothing spectacular about this church. Built in 1874 it is one of the older churches in Mussoorie. Most of the time the gate is locked. Inside one can see a few memorial tablets.

title: Peaceful point
review: This is a nice serene place situated near Picture palace side of the Mall.

title: Calm and quiet spiritual place located in the middle of the bussiest area of Mussoorie
review: This serene old Church is at the Picture Palace end of the Mall Road which is crowded and noisy all the time. You can walk into this age old Church with wooden furniture to take a spiritual break for a short while.

title: Near Picture Palace
review: There are two churches near to the mall road. One is Mussoorie Christ Church and second is Union church. Union church is near Picture Palace. It was closed when I visited this church during my Mussoorie visit.

title: Holy
review: Too clean and full of holiness, busy like others on Sundays, calm and soothing experiences from this place

title: Old chutch
review: Situated near Picture Palace and on road going towards Clock Tower. We could not enter in church as being closed at partucular period. But whatever we gathered from the glimpse of Union Church was unique and  it showed how the place was untouchable.

title: Union Church Mussoorie
review: Union Church is one of the oldest churches in Mussoorie, built in 1874.  It is a inter-denominational church and its members/congregation are both local as well as from diverse backgrounds.  We meet at 10 a.m. for Sunday Worship.  Join us when you come to Mussoorie for an uplifting spiritual experience.  You will be blessed

title: CHURCH FROM DAYS OF THE THE RAJ
review: Mussoorie is dotted with numerous Churches, each with an interesting History. The Union Church while looking Sombre in Grey seems to double up as a school as well.

title: A 143 year old Church near Picture Palace.
review: While visiting places, I like to see old buildings which have represent architecture of that period or a specific style of architecture. For this reason I like old unaltered temples or churches. This church indeed has a traditional basic style of architecture. It was coloured in a pattern which was new to me. I believe that it was not in original plan but coloured in this way some years ago. Maybe some other Mussoorie buildings have also been coloured in similar fashion. Electrical poles, wires, banners, trees etc have obscured views of all good buildings of Mussoorie and same was the case here. However, I managed to get some good pictures from roof of my hotel since it was close to Church.
